definition: The terms in this category are related to clients on an IOTA network

address.definition: A public key that belongs to a seed and that has a balance of IOTA tokens on IOTA networks

faucet.definition: A tool that transfers IOTA tokens to a given address

private key.definition: A secret key that is derived from a seed and can be used to prove ownership of an address

spent address.definition: An address that has already been withdrawn from in a signed input transaction in the Tangle and that is unsafe to withdraw from again

security level.definition: Parameter that affects the security of one-time signatures

seed.definition: Unique password that is used to generate addresses, private keys, and signatures

wallet.definition: Application for managing private keys and addresses

definition: The terms in this category are related to cryptography

Curl.definition: Hashing function, designed for the Internet of things, that uses the SHA-3 sponge-based construction

Kerl.definition: Ternary version of the Keccek-384 hashing function that takes a 48 byte input and produces a 243 trit output, using two's complement

definition: The terms in this category are related to IOTA networks

blowball.definition: Subtangle where a large group of tip transactions reference one central transaction

Coordinator.definition: Client that sends milestones that nodes trust to use as a consensus rule

GoShimmer node.definition: Node that runs the GoShimmer node software

gossip.definition: Forward a transaction onto another node for validation

Hornet node.definition: Node that runs the Hornet node software

IOTA token.definition: Unit of value that belongs to addresses and that can be transferred over an IOTA network in transactions

IRI node.definition: Node that runs the IRI node software

local snapshot.definition: Process in which a node saves the current state of the Tangle in local files

neighbor.definition: Relationship between nodes that gossip transaction among each other

node.definition: Device that has read and write access to the Tangle

node quorum.definition: A group of nodes to which clients send the same API requests and compare the responses for consistency

permanode.definition: A node that never prunes transactions from its database and enables applications to search the full history of the Tangle

solidify.definition: Request the past cone of all milestones in the Tangle from neighbors, starting from an entry point milestone and ending at the latest one

subtangle.definition: Section of the Tangle that contains transactions between a milestone and tip transactions

Tangle.definition: Immutable data structure that contains an up-to-date history of transactions, each of which references two others

definition: The terms in this category are related to transactions

bundle.definition: Chain of transactions that are ordered by their `currentIndex` field and that are considered atomic by nodes

bundle essence.definition: The `address`, `value`, `obsoleteTag`, `currentIndex`, `lastIndex`, and `timestamp` fields of transactions in a bundle

child.definition: Relationship between a transaction and those to which it is attached in the Tangle

confirmed.definition: State of a transaction when it fulfills the consensus rules of the nodes in the network

depth.definition: The milestone offset from which nodes start tip selection in the Tangle

double spend.definition: A state in the Tangle when two or more transactions try to transfer the same IOTA tokens from an address

future cone.definition: A group of decendant transactions in the Tangle, starting from and including a child transaction

input transaction.definition: Transaction with a negative value that withdraws IOTA tokens from an address

local proof of work.definition: Proof of work that is done on the same device as the one that creates the transaction

minimum weight magnitude.definition: A setting for proof of work that defines the number of trailing zeros that a transaction hash must have to be accepted by nodes in an IOTA network

milestone.definition: Signed transaction that is sent by the Coordinator

output transaction.definition: Transaction with a positive value that deposits IOTA tokens into an address

outsourced proof of work.definition: Proof of work that is done on a device that is neither a node nor the device that creates the transaction

parent.definition: Transaction that is directly referenced by a child transaction

past cone.definition: A group of ancestor transactions in the Tangle, starting from and including a child transaction

pending.definition: State of a transaction when it's attached to the Tangle, but not yet confirmed

promote.definition: Send a zero-value transaction that references the tail transaction of a pending bundle and the latest milestone to increase its chances of being chosen during tip selection

proof of work.definition: Cryptographic proof that energy has been spent in computing power to solve a puzzle

reattach.definition: Recreate and resend a transaction that is too old to be confirmed

rebroadcast.definition: Send the same transaction to a node again

remote proof of work.definition: Proof of work that is done on a node by calling its `getTransactionsToApprove` endpoint

solid.definition: State of a transaction when a node has its past cone

tip selection.definition: Process whereby a node selects two tip transactions from the Tangle

tip transaction.definition: Transaction that has no children in the Tangle

transaction.definition: An object that is stored in the Tangle and that nodes in an IOTA network can process

zero-value transaction.definition: Transaction with no value that may contain any arbitrary data such as messages or signatures
